tn.text: After reminding them to follow him the way he follows Christ, Paul gives some specific instructs in how women and men are to live as believers.
"think of" or "consider"
Possible meanings are 1) "Because of this, I want" or 2) "However, I want."
has authority over

tn.ref: a man is the head of a woman
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "men are to have authority over women" or 2) "the husband is to have authority over the wife"
"and does so after placing a cloth or veil over his head"
Possible meanings are 1) "brings disgrace on himself" (UDB) or 2) "brings disgrace on Christ, who is his head."

tn.ref: woman who prays ... dishonors her head
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "woman who prays ... brings disgrace on herself" (UDB) or 2) "wife who prays ... brings disgrace on her husband."
That is, without the cloth that was worn on the top of the head and that covered the hair and shoulders.

tn.ref: as if her head were shaved
tn.text: as if she had removed all the hair on her head with a razor

tn.ref: If it is disgraceful for a woman
tn.text: It was a mark of disgrace or humiliation for a woman to have her hair shaved off or cut short.
place on her head the cloth that was worn on the top of the head and that covered the hair and shoulders

tn.ref: should not have his head covered
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "must not cover his head" or 2) "does not need to cover his head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Just as man reflects God's greatness, the woman reflects the man's character.

tn.ref: For man was not made from woman. Instead, woman was made from man
tn.text: God made the woman by taking a bone from the man and making the woman from that bone. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God did not make the man from the woman. Instead, he made the woman from the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

These words and all of [[:en:bible:notes:1co:11:07|11:8]] could be put in parentheses so that the reader can see that the word "this" in "this is why ... the angels" clearly refers back to the words "the woman is the glory of the man" in [[:en:bible:notes:1co:11:07|11:7]].

tn.ref: have a symbol of authority on her head
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "to symbolize that she has man as her head" or 2) "to symbolize that she has the authority to pray or prophesy."
"While what I have just said is all true, the most important thing is this:"
Possible meanings are 1) "among Christians, who belong to the Lord" or 2) "in the world as created by God."

tn.ref: the woman is not independent from the man, nor is the man independent from the woman
tn.text: This can be stated positively. AT: "the woman depends on the man, and the man depends on the woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
"God created everything"
"Judge this issue according to the local customs and church practices you know"

tn.ref: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?
tn.text: Paul expects the Corinthians to agree with him. This can be stated in active form. "To honor God, a woman should pray to God with a covering on her head." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Does not even nature itself teach you ... for him?
tn.text: Paul expects the Corinthians to agree with him. AT: "Nature itself even teaches you ... for him." He is speaking of the way people in society normally act as if it were a person who teaches. AT: "You know just from looking at the way people normally act ... for him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: For her hair has been given to her
tn.text: "For God created woman with hair" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

As Paul talks about communion, the Lord's supper, he reminds them to have right attitudes as well as unity. He reminds them that if they fail in those things when taking communion, they will become sick and die, as has already happened to some of them.

tn.ref: in the following instructions, I do not praise you. For when
tn.text: Another possible meaning is "as I give you these instructions, there is something for which I cannot praise you: when"
"directions" or "policies"
"gather together" or "meet"

tn.ref: it is not for the better but for the worse
tn.text: "you do not help each other; instead, you harm each other"
"as believers." Paul is not talking about being inside a building.
"you divide yourselves into groups"

tn.ref: so that those who are approved may be recognized among you
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "so that people will know the most highly regarded believers among you" or 2) "so that people can display this approval to the others among you." Paul may have been using irony, saying the opposite of what he wanted the Corinthians to understand, to shame them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
Possible meanings are 1) "whom God approves" or 2) "whom you, the church, approve."
"gather together"

tn.ref: it is not the Lord's Supper that you eat
tn.text: "you may believe you are eating the Lord's Supper, but you do not treat it with respect"

tn.ref: to eat and to drink in
tn.text: "in which to gather for a meal"
hate or treat with dishonor and disrespect
embarrass or cause to feel shame

tn.ref: What should I say to you? Should I praise you?
tn.text: Paul is rebuking the Corinthians. AT: "I can say nothing good about this. I cannot praise you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you, that the Lord
tn.text: "For it was from the Lord that I heard what I told you, and it was this: the Lord"

tn.ref: on the night when he was betrayed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "on the night that Judas Iscariot betrayed him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"he pulled pieces from it"
"The bread I am holding is my body"

It is best to translate this literally. The Corinthians knew which cup he took, so it is not simply "a cup" or "some cup" or "any cup." Possible meanings are that it was 1) the cup of wine that one would expect him to use or 2) the third or fourth of the four cups of wine that the Jews drank at the Passover meal.

tn.ref: Do this as often as you drink it
tn.text: "Drink from this cup, and as often as you drink from it"
teach about the crucifixion and resurrection
Where Jesus comes to can be made explicit. AT: "until Jesus comes back to the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord
tn.text: "eats the bread of the Lord or drinks the cup of the Lord"

Paul speaks of a person looking at his relationship to God and how he has been living his life as if that person is looking over something he wants to buy. See how "test the quality" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1co:03:12|3:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) "and does not recognize that the church is the body of the Lord" or 2) "and does not consider that he is handling the Lord's body." (UDB)
These words mean almost the same thing and can be combined, as in UDB.

Paul speaks of a person looking at his relationship to God and how he has been living his life as if that person is looking over something he wants to buy. See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1co:11:27|11:28]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will not judge us" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: we are judged by the Lord, we are disciplined, so that we may not be condemned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Lord judges us, he disciplines us, so that he will not condemn us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
gather to eat a meal together before celebrating the Lord's Supper
"allow the others to arrive before beginning the meal"
"let him eat before attending this gathering"

tn.ref: it will not be for judgment
tn.text: "it will not be an occasion for God to discipline you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
